com.facebook.react.views.art

Class ARTVirtualNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.react.uimanager.ReactShadowNodeImpl
      • com.facebook.react.views.art.ARTVirtualNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReactShadowNode<ReactShadowNodeImpl>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ARTGroupShadowNode, ARTShapeShadowNode

    public abstract class ARTVirtualNode
extends ReactShadowNodeImpl
    Base class for ARTView virtual nodes: ARTGroupShadowNode, ARTShapeShadowNode and indirectly for ARTTextShadowNode.

    • Method Detail

      • isVirtual

        public boolean isVirtual()
        Description copied from class: ReactShadowNodeImpl
        Nodes that return true will be treated as "virtual" nodes. That is, nodes that are not mapped into native views (e.g. nested text node). By default this method returns false.
        Specified by:
        isVirtual in interface ReactShadowNode<ReactShadowNodeImpl>
        Overrides:
        isVirtual in class ReactShadowNodeImpl

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
                          android.graphics.Paint paint,
                          float opacity)

      • saveAndSetupCanvas

        protected final void saveAndSetupCanvas(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
        Sets up the transform matrix on the canvas before an element is drawn. NB: for perf reasons this does not apply opacity, as that would mean creating a new canvas layer (which allocates an offscreen bitmap) and having it composited afterwards. Instead, the drawing code should apply opacity recursively.
        Parameters:
        canvas - the canvas to set up

      • restoreCanvas

        protected void restoreCanvas(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
        Restore the canvas after an element was drawn. This is always called in mirror with saveAndSetupCanvas(android.graphics.Canvas).
        Parameters:
        canvas - the canvas to restore

      • setOpacity

        public void setOpacity(float opacity)
